byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway reported from Berlin, and Declan Walsh from New York.

lead_paragraph: A militia attacked and seized as many as three major oil terminals, not long after the militia that had held them signed a deal with the unity government to resume oil exports.

headline.print_headline: Militia Seizes Libyan Oil Ports in Challenge to Government
headline.main: Militia Seizes Libyan Oil Terminals in Challenge to Government

snippet: A militia attacked and seized as many as three major oil terminals, not long after the militia that had held them signed a deal with the unity government to resume oil exports....
abstract: Forces under Gen Khalifa Hifter, leader of Libyan National Army, seize oil ports of Ras Lanuf, Es Sider and Zueitina, expelling Petroleum Facilites Guard militia; takeover of Libya's primary source of wealth is concerning to many, but seriously impacts shaky unity government backed by United Nations.
